questions.question: What is the primary function of Microsoft PowerPoint?
questions.feedback: Microsoft PowerPoint is primarily used for creating presentations with slides, text, images, and animations.

questions.question: Which tab in PowerPoint contains the 'New Slide' option?
questions.feedback: The 'New Slide' option is located under the 'Home' tab in PowerPoint.

questions.question: What is the shortcut key to start a slideshow in Microsoft PowerPoint?
questions.feedback: Pressing F5 starts the slideshow from the beginning.

questions.question: Which feature allows you to apply consistent formatting to all slides in a presentation?
questions.feedback: The Slide Master feature allows you to set consistent formatting, such as fonts and layouts, for all slides.

questions.question: What is the purpose of the 'Transitions' feature in PowerPoint?
options: To add effects when moving between slides
questions.correct: To add effects when moving between slides
questions.feedback: Transitions control how one slide moves to the next during a presentation.

questions.question: What is the default file extension for PowerPoint presentations?
questions.feedback: .pptx is the default file format for PowerPoint presentations.

questions.question: What does the 'Rehearse Timings' feature do in PowerPoint?
options: It helps practice and record slide timings
questions.correct: It helps practice and record slide timings
questions.feedback: The 'Rehearse Timings' feature helps presenters practice and record the timing for each slide.

questions.question: How do you insert an image into a PowerPoint slide?
options: Click on the 'Home' tab and select 'Insert Image'
Click on the 'Insert' tab and select 'Pictures'
Right-click on the slide and choose 'Add Image'
questions.correct: Click on the 'Insert' tab and select 'Pictures'
questions.feedback: To insert an image, go to the 'Insert' tab and choose 'Pictures'.

questions.question: What is the purpose of the 'Animations' feature in PowerPoint?
options: To apply movement effects to objects on a slide
questions.correct: To apply movement effects to objects on a slide
questions.feedback: The 'Animations' feature allows you to add movement effects to objects such as text, images, and shapes.

questions.question: What is the shortcut key to duplicate a slide in PowerPoint?
questions.feedback: Ctrl + D is the shortcut key to duplicate a selected slide in PowerPoint.

questions.question: Which view allows you to see all the slides in a presentation at once?
questions.feedback: The Slide Sorter view displays all the slides in a presentation as thumbnails.

questions.question: How can you change the layout of a slide?
options: By using the 'Layout' button in the 'Home' tab
questions.correct: By using the 'Layout' button in the 'Home' tab
questions.feedback: You can change the layout of a slide by using the 'Layout' button in the 'Home' tab.

questions.question: What is the purpose of the 'Notes' section in PowerPoint?
options: To add speaker notes for each slide
questions.correct: To add speaker notes for each slide
questions.feedback: The 'Notes' section allows you to add speaker notes for each slide.

questions.question: Which feature allows you to add a video to a slide?
questions.feedback: You can add a video to a slide using the 'Insert Video' feature.

questions.question: How do you save a PowerPoint presentation as a PDF?
questions.feedback: To save a PowerPoint presentation as a PDF, go to File > Export > Create PDF/XPS Document.

questions.question: What is the purpose of the 'Slide Show' tab?
options: To set up and run the presentation
questions.correct: To set up and run the presentation
questions.feedback: The 'Slide Show' tab contains options to set up and run the presentation.

questions.question: Which feature allows you to add a hyperlink to a slide?
questions.feedback: You can add a hyperlink to a slide using the 'Insert Hyperlink' feature.

questions.question: How do you change the theme of a presentation?
questions.feedback: You can change the theme of a presentation by going to Design > Themes.

questions.question: What is the purpose of the 'Format Painter' tool?
options: To copy formatting from one object to another
questions.correct: To copy formatting from one object to another
questions.feedback: The 'Format Painter' tool allows you to copy formatting from one object to another.

questions.question: Which feature allows you to add a table to a slide?
questions.feedback: You can add a table to a slide using the 'Insert Table' feature.
